title: Assuming someone is already proficient in writing music, what is the best way for that person to become a score composer for movies, TV, or video games? - Quora

response.answer_text: Knowing the right people and being able to write and record in an extremely short amount of time, basing your pieces only from a very vague feeling/emotion that is described to you. You have to work your way up and it takes a while. You have to be okay with a lot of people saying no and you have to understand how competitive the business is. A lot of music being pumped out commercially like this is very similar in quality and style to the kinds of really well produced pop songs out there now. There is not really job security in this business especially for people new to scene, it’s literally survival of the fittest.
